title: Should you stay in a loveless marriage?
text:

Making a marriage work is hard work and it is the rare couple that manages to keep the embers of love glowing when the going gets tough. In many marriages, over time, love and sex both dwindle and partners go through the motions of the marriage just for the sake of the kids or shared finances, or concern about societal opinion. However, the question is whether one should stay in a loveless marriages or call it quits.In the short term, staying in a marriage that seems to have run its course seems like just waste of time. However, some studies seem to suggest that sticking it out could be beneficial in the long run. This is especially true for marriages that have come under strain due to the arrival of a child. According to research commissioned by themarriagefoundation.org, it was found that couples who stayed in unhappy marriages after the birth of their first child reported being happy after 10 years. In fact, 27 percent said they were "extremely happy."People have varied reasons for sticking on in marriages; however, fear should not be one of them. If you are staying on because you are afraid of your husband or his anger that tends to result in abuse, or in a worst-case scenario, a threat to your life; you should probably gather your guts and make a getaway at the first chance to do so. Staying on is risky for your personal safety and mental peace.Are you so tired of living without sex that you would consider walking out just so that you could have a normal physical relationship with a man once again? Well, before you take that drastic step, sit him down for a conversation and explain that you are not willing to put up with a lack of sex anymore. Consult a sexologist or a couples counsellor to figure out how to get your sex life back on track. Take a decision if the situation doesn’t improve.Do you feel that you are more invested in your relationship than he is? Do you want to improve the relationship while he shows no such interest? Well, forcing a person to become involved in a relationship is super-difficult if he has lost interest. You could thrash out the issue with your partner and take help from a counsellor, however, be warned that these measures may not help if he has already mentally moved out of the relationship.All couples bicker but is that all that you do? And are your fights super toxic and ugly? Well, both of you have a lot of resentment and anger shored up against each other and it erupts in these ugly face-offs. Try and reason what exactly triggers these extreme reactions. Also, analyse how you feel about your partner after these fights. If you have the urge to make up after the fight then there is still hope for the relationship, however if you feel desolate, lonely and hopeless, the relationship is probably beyond repair.
description: Is your marriage just a sham with no sex or love to speak of? Here we discuss if you should continue to stay in such a marriage
